summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (20-CR-330). The order addresses the government's motion to preclude testimony from six of eight expert witnesses noticed by the defense. The court grants the motion to preclude as to Dr. Ryan Hall and Bennett Gershman, and orders the parties to propose any redactions to the sealed opinions and moving papers.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in this court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge who issued this order in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ryan Hall
persons.context: Referred to as Dr. Ryan Hall, an expert witness whose testimony the defense noticed and the government moved to preclude. The court granted the motion to preclude his testimony.

persons.name: Bennett Gershman
persons.context: An expert witness whose testimony the defense noticed and the government moved to preclude. The court granted the motion to preclude his testimony.

connections.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Dr. Ryan Hall was an expert witness noticed by the defense for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
Bennett Gershman was an expert witness noticed by the defense for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.

events.title: Defense Notices Expert Witnesses
events.description: The defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case noticed eight expert witnesses.

events.title: Government Files Motion to Preclude Experts
events.description: The government filed a motion to preclude the testimony of six of the eight expert witnesses noticed by the defense.

events.title: Defense Files Response to Motion
events.description: The defense filed a response to the government's motion to preclude expert testimony.

events.title: Court Issues Order on Expert Testimony
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order granting the government's motion to preclude testimony from Dr. Ryan Hall and Bennett Gershman, and set deadlines for sealing/redaction proposals.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court granted the government's motion to preclude testimony from two defense expert witnesses: Dr. Ryan Hall and Bennett Gershman.
The defense had originally noticed eight expert witnesses on November 1, 2021, and the government moved to preclude six of them.
The court's memorandum opinions and orders on the motion were temporarily filed under seal, with the parties ordered to propose any necessary redactions by November 24, 2021.
The legal standard for sealing/redaction is based on the Second Circuit's test in Lugosch v. Pyramid Co. of Onondaga.
This document is a procedural order in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-330).
